availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George E. Sangston (Baltimore, Maryland, merchant and court clerk.)

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, merchant and court clerk. Maryland native. Married to Anna Sangston. Father of Annie E. Sangston and George E. Sangston. Dry good merchant in Baltimore, Baltimore County, Maryland, in 1850. Clerk of the Superior Court of Baltimore City in 1860. Employed Jane Eden and Rachael Tucker as domestic servants in Baltimore in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 13, p. 375A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore, Ward 12, p. 17.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore, Ward 10, p. 576A.
